label: Petition from Ann Sturgin to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Ann Sturgin to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that she is an impoverished widow who is immobilized by old age and poor health.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Ann Sturgin to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that she is an impoverished widow who is immobilized by old age and poor health.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the honourable Mr Days

Tresurer Sir      August  22 - 1771

I being A poor woman and in Distress at present for want of A little Suply [supply] and am obliged to aply [apply] to your hounour [honor] for it and the most of all is for wood and I am not able to go and fetcht [fetch] it myself Being very Lame and and [sic] a small subsistante [subsistence] would Be of a very grate [great] help to me if your hounour will Take it in Consideration and help me with That small matter and I hope Dear Sir you will will [sic] have the Blessing of the poor widow

M Ann Sturgin

If St. Andrews can spare five pounds be pleas'd to give it to Ann Sturgin.
Augt. 23r [illegible] [British pound symbol] 5 - Mister L.W. Moulting
